title: Prohibits public employers from abolishing positions occupied by public employees absent on military duty
summary: Prohibits public employers from abolishing positions occupied by public employees absent on military duty unless a similar position is created and the employee appointed thereto.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                    January 7, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. CASTELLI -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Governmental Employees

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  military law, in relation to prohibiting public
         employers from  abolishing  positions  occupied  by  public  employees
         absent on military duty

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 243 of the military law is amended by adding a  new
    2  subdivision 11-a to read as follows:
    3    11-A.  NOTWITHSTANDING  THE  PROVISIONS  OF SUBDIVISION ELEVEN OF THIS
    4  SECTION OR ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW TO THE CONTRARY, NO PUBLIC EMPLOY-
    5  ER SHALL ABOLISH A POSITION OCCUPIED BY A PUBLIC EMPLOYEE ENGAGED IN THE
    6  PERFORMANCE OF MILITARY DUTY UNLESS THE PUBLIC EMPLOYER CREATES  ANOTHER
    7  POSITION FOR THE PERFORMANCE OF DUTIES SIMILAR TO THOSE PERFORMED IN THE
    8  POSITION  ABOLISHED AND APPOINTS THE PUBLIC EMPLOYEE UPON TERMINATION OF
    9  HIS OR HER MILITARY DUTY TO THE POSITION THUS CREATED WITHOUT  REDUCTION
   10  IN SALARY OR INCREMENT.
   11    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
